comment.body: I'm in the same boat wondering how companies will monetize ZeroNet sites, at least if it survives long enough for companies to notice it. There would have to be a way or else most likely people with any sort of intention to make any money would abandon the platform.
A 32GB SD card is $10 now!? Last time I bought one it was about $30 and it was only 4GB. Wow times change quickly...

@Quadrangle: He also mentioned it being closed source. Oftentimes if there is a free and open source option available, and there aren't any real notable sacrifices made to use it, most people prefer the open source program over the closed source one.

Mirrored the pastebin links to nullpaste

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1EN9Ape9Gbe2FAcP8qNWsyvg7x7z92LhA7_0

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1EN9Ape9Gbe2FAcP8qNWsyvg7x7z92LhA7_1
What happens if you download a copy of ZeroNet from the original website and just copy your data folder in? The updater was broken for me for some reason so that's what I did to get it working.
